source.citation: Spinelli, R., Hartsough, B. & Magagnotti, N. 2010. Productivity standards for harvesters and processors in Italy. Forest Products Journal 60(3):226-235.
notes: Regression dataset derived from 15,148 cycles recorded in 38 Italian CTL studies (1998–2008), covering harvesters and processors working in plantations, coppice, and forests.

Equations predict cycle-element time (10^-2 minutes per tree) using tree volume, slope, removals/residuals per hectare, carrier power/type, head type, and species dummies (chestnut/poplar, other hardwood).
Accessory time coefficients (relative to cyclic time): 14.7% for harvesting in natural forests, 29.6% for processing at landing decks.
Delay coefficients (relative to productive + accessory time) from Spinelli & Visser (2008): 50% for forest harvesting, 21% for plantation harvesting, 44% for deck processing.

tree_volume_m3.description: Merchantable stem volume per tree (m³). Validated range 0.005–7 m³.

carrier_power_kw.description: Prime mover gross power (kW). Dataset medians ≈75–160 kW.

residuals_per_ha.description: Residual trees per hectare after treatment (used in harvest move equation).

species_group.description: Species dummy capturing poplar/chestnut vs. other hardwoods vs. conifers.

stand_type.description: Stand classification: forest (natural), plantation, or coppice.

operation_type.description: Operation (harvest standing trees vs. process decked timber).

move_stand.expression: 7.5 + (12412 + 771 * slope_percent + 46706 * spider + 63153 * tractor) / removals_per_ha + 0.204 * residuals_per_ha / carrier_power_kw**0.5
move_stand.note: Dummy variables spider/tractor equal 1 when applicable.

brush.note: Brush only applied to harvest operations in forests.

fell.expression: 3.8 + 156.5 * tree_volume_m3 / carrier_power_kw**0.5 + 1.18 * non_spider * slope_percent + 6.5 * excavator + 24.8 * tractor + spider * (25.5 + 188.5 * tree_volume_m3) / carrier_power_kw**0.5

process.expression: 22.7 + 1.433 * tree_volume_m3**(-1) * slope_percent + (1115 + 446 * stroke + 2244 * tractor - 362 * chestnut_poplar + 1118 * other_hardwood) * tree_volume_m3 / carrier_power_kw**0.5
process.note: Equation simplified placeholder; actual implementation coded in Python for clarity.
